page.title: 02Industry in Kidderminster
page.content: The{carpet industry}is still the major employer in the town of Kidderminster. Most of its factories are around the town centre but a number of them have weaving sheds in the Oldington area of the town. At the turn of the century, a number of attempts were made to start a{sugar {beet}factory in Kidderminster. Not until 1925, when 2700 acres of beet were grown, did the sugar beet factory open at Foley Park. The beet slicing trade is a somewhat seasonal one, so not all the labour used is local. This one plant for converting home-grown beet into sugar has made a substantial contribution to the country's supplies.
